thread.title: Re: People keep photoshopping new mottos for the Washington Post and it’s HILARIOUS
thread.title_full: Re: People keep photoshopping new mottos for the Washington Post and it’s HILARIOUS

author: Walt H.
title: Re: People keep photoshopping new mottos for the Washington Post and it’s HILARIOUS
text:
People keep photoshopping new mottos for the Washington Post and it’s HILARIOUS Posted at 1:49 pm on February 22, 2017 by Greg P. 
As you’ve probably heard by now, the Washington Post revealed a new motto today across all of its platforms: “Democracy Dies in Darkness.” The @washingtonpost has a new slogan. And it's…awesome. pic.twitter.com/VFNbSRPtjG 
— ProPublica (@ProPublica) February 22, 2017 
Yeah, not really that awesome: I thought people were joking about this new WP motto: "democracy dies in darkness." They were not. I shouldn't be laughing so hard. 
According to CNN’s Brian Stelter, Washington Post owner Jeff Bezos first used the phrase last year, and it’s caught on: WashPost's new "value statement:" 
— Brian Stelter (@brianstelter) February 18, 2017 
Anyway, Twitter is doing its thing and photoshopping new mottos for the Washington Post, which are hilarious. Here are some of the better ones we’ve seen: Woah check out the Washington Post's new slogan. pic.twitter.com/DQN0ue1iLa 
— Caleb Ecarma (@calebecarma) February 22, 2017 Look, I know there's not a lot of good news, but let's not give up hope. pic.twitter.com/JNjGq4cGUC
